author: Special Correspondent
text:
Maintaining its winning spree in local polls, the Congress party on Sunday took a massive lead in the municipal council elections in Manipur, winning 108 out of the 278 seats.

Polling took place across 18 municipal councils and eight nagar panchayats on January 11. About 278 councillors and 586 nagar panchayat members were to be selected in the State’s four districts — Imphal West, Thoubal, Imphal East, and Bishnupur.

While the Congress leads the polls after bagging 108 seats, the BJP won 62, the CPI two, the Lok Janashakti Party four and the Independents 102.

Senior Congress leader and Manipur’s Deputy Chief Minister Gaikhangam gridlocked with the BJP State unit president Thounaojam Chaoba over which party made significant electoral gains in the polls.

The Congress high command perceives recent poll gains in Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat, Mumbai and now in Manipur as the initial signs of recovery from the 2014 Lok Sabha debacle.
title: Congress takes lead in Manipur municipal polls
